Description: Upper body sherd of black-figured pottery closed vase; exterior, from top: trace of frieze; black-figure animal frieze, preserving much of a lion to right, forelegs, chest and head missing, with added red on mane, back and hind leg; to right; rosettes and dots as filling ornament; broad band with superimposed white and red bands; third frieze with only part of rosette as filling ornament preserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.055)
